result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Christopher L Ostrum was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher L Ostrum in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Attorney Zell requests a pre-disposition investigation be conducted. Attorney Slattery states that would not be necessary and requests that a Conditional Release Report be prepared.   Court finds that a treatment plan would be appropriate.  Court questions Alexa Webb, a nurse case manager with Wood County.  

Court orders a conditional release plan for a period of 18 months and orders defendant to comply with the terms of the plan.  Court orders costs of the action.
Defendant Christopher L Ostrum in court, via video from Trempeleau County, with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Body Only
Attorney Travis Stephen Slattery in court.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea hearing on December 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 13, 2014 at 11:00 am.
for Examination under 971.16
Defendant appears before warrant is issued.
Attorney Travis Stephen Slattery in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Arraignment on September 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.

8:50 a.m. Defendant Christopher L Ostrum in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Kelly A. Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Lehn call Officer Van Berkel as a witness and he testifies to the events of August 9th involving an attempted traffic stop.  Testifies that the he had his lights activated and that the vehicle should have been aware of the lights.  Officer Van Berkel testifies the identification of vehicle and testifies that the speed reached up to 100 MPH.  Testifies that the Pittsville Police Depart. where able to stop the vehicle.  Testifies that the driver of the vehicle was identified as the defendant.  Atty. Slattery questions the witness.  The witness testifies that he didn't not get close enough to the vehicle to see who was driving.  Testifies that he followed the vehicle for over a mile.  Testifies to why he didn't pursue the vehicle after the overhead.  8:58 a.m.  Officer Krakow is sworn as witness and testifies to being an officer for the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department.  Testifies to working and his observations of August 9, 2014.  Testifies to having contact with the defendant on that day and before.  The witness identifies the defendant as Christopher L Ostrum.  Arraignment scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 9, 2014 at 08:45 am.
(Defendant)
